title: Chennai shopping decoded
text:
Travel Articles | September 29, 2015 
Chennai is a city resplendent with shopping malls and street side stores that sell beautiful silk items. Well, this isn’t all as the city is lined with shopping centres that sell garments, handicrafts, cotton linen and other such merchandise. You should go through the list below that highlights the places to shop in Chennai. 
Saree festival at Nalli 
Labeled as a city special treat, Nalli is a store that deals in high quality based silk sarees. It was established in the year 1928 by Nalli Chinnaswami Chetti and has a rich collection of kanchipurams that come laden with heavy zari work and gold threads. This shop is one of the oldest silk saree stores in all of Chennai. Visiting this place is a real treat as the merchandise that is presented before one seems to have come from another realm. Silk dhotis and wedding sarees are also available here and thus this store is on our list of places to shop in Chennai. 
Cotton and more silk 
A street in Egmore is famous for its cotton items, thus earning the name, Cotton Street. The climate in Chennai calls for such light clothing and this street does brisk business during the summer months. This place has around 60 stalls that throw up a choice of colours and patterns when it comes to cotton garments. Yes, you would be wise to make a short trip to this street and go through the stuff that you are sure to use during those hot and sweaty months. The jaw dropping deals and prices is a steal here, 
Big ol’ Spencer 
Not only is Spencer’s Plaza in Anna Salia the largest mall in Chennai but it is also the oldest, not just in the city, but in the country. Bang opposite to the Vivanta (a hotel by the Taj Group), this mall has around 400 shops selling items that include clothing to groceries, home items and the likes. The place also houses a grad number of national and international brands and is dotted with a lot of souvenir shops that sell little knick knacks. Though not as elegant as the other malls, this slice of history is a great place to shop at in the city of Chennai. 
Dhotis and Sarees galore 
For more silken delights, the Rangachari Cloth store at Mylapore is your best bet. The place keeps a stock of the best silks and cotton sarees like chinnalapattu and Madurai. Men are not to be left out and can choose from a wide range of shirts, towels and dhotis. The garments here are of superior quality and make for a great buy. You sure know the worth of silk sarees, don’t you? Rangachari has the best silk sarees to offer. The wedding sarees are a steal with the beautiful work on them. It is these sarees that have made the place famous and thus we ought to have it listed as some of the best places to shop in Chennai.   
This article has been penned by Saurav Mishra and touches upon the various places to shop in Chennai . It highlights streets that provide the best deals and as well as high end stores.
